description:
The problem I experienced and a solution is described under the following link:

https://ask.openstack.org/en/question/57296/juno-centos-7-buildabortexception-build-of-instance-aborted-failed-to-allocate-the-networks-not-rescheduling/

It was also reported here:

https://ask.openstack.org/en/question/56759/cant-launch-instance-in-secondary-compute-node/

Basically in my case I had to forcefully upgrade 2014.2.1-1 to 2014.2-2. But it seems that repos for Ubuntu and Centos are not updated properly.
title: Incompatibility between nova 2014.2 and 2014.2.1-1

comments.content:
The problem I experienced and a solution is described under the following link:

https://ask.openstack.org/en/question/57296/juno-centos-7-buildabortexception-build-of-instance-aborted-failed-to-allocate-the-networks-not-rescheduling/

It was also reported here:

https://ask.openstack.org/en/question/56759/cant-launch-instance-in-secondary-compute-node/

Basically in my case I had to forcefully upgrade 2014.2.1-1 to 2014.2-2. But it seems that repos for Ubuntu and Centos are not updated properly.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mazur-7

comments.content: Actually I have just noticed that 2014.2-2 is OpenStack Kilo package.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mazur-7

comments.content: I am not clear what the nova bug is here. Or was this just a  packaging issue?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jogo

comments.content:
What do you mean by packaging issue ? Incorrect versions of some files were incorporated into packages for different linux distros ?
By bug I meant that slightly different versions are not interoperable.

It seems to have been corrected

https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1405741

The thing is - my controller was on 2014.2 -> compute was on 2014.2-1-1 (was not working, issue described in all links above)
Upgrade to 2014.2-2 solved the problem.

Afterwards I installed another compute node and it was on 2014.2.2.dev11 (OpenSUSE that time) and it was not working with controller on 2014.2 (same symptoms as above), so finally I have upgraded controller to run 2014.2.1, now it seems to be working fine with all compute nodes.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mazur-7

comments.content:
hi , please i need a help

i cannot create instance after installing trove.there is not a nova compute when i do nova-manage service list et get this

Binary Host Zone Status State Updated_At nova-conductor ubuntu-VirtualBox internal enabled :-) 2015-03-10 14:16:57 nova-cert ubuntu-VirtualBox internal enabled :-) 2015-03-10 14:16:56 nova-scheduler ubuntu-VirtualBox internal enabled :-) 2015-03-10 14:17:00 nova-consoleauth ubuntu-VirtualBox internal enabled :-) 2015-03-10 14:17:01

i tried to install the nova compute packages but was not be able to do it.

how can i fix it?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~bintou-16
